title: Charli XCX flaunts her quirky style in tight flame-print trousers for concert in California
text:
She recently showed off her 'creepy and old' British style mansion in Hollywood.

And Charli XCX proved that California was tell and truly home as she performed in style at The Fox Theater in Oakland on Wednesday.

The singer, 27, flaunted her quirky style in a colourful top as well as fire-print trousers which put focus on her peachy posterior.

Eyes on her: Charli XCX, 27, proved that California was tell and truly home as she performed in style at The Fox Theater in Oakland on Wednesday

Charli wowed in her funky get-up, which consisted of the heavily printed top, complete with baggy sleeves and a turtleneck.

The Boom Clap hitmaker added a glittering body chain across her chest, while a thick, chunky chain was attached to her trousers.

Despite the dark, atmospheric stadium, the British hitmaker added to the look with a pair of quirky shades and drop earrings.

Charli's sensational stage performance comes after she opened up the doors of her British inspired pad to Architectural Digest.

Quirky: The singer flaunted her quirky style in a colourful top as well as fire-print trousers which put focus on her peachy posterior

Looking good: Charli wowed in her funky get-up, which consisted of the heavily printed top, complete with baggy sleeves and a turtleneck

Speaking to the iconic interiors publication, the brunette explained: 'It's funny that I moved across the world and still ended up in an archetypal British house.

'I liked that this was an old place and immediately loved it. I love the dark wood. I love that it's a little creepy and weird. It just felt really right for me.'

Charli burst onto the scene after signing a contract with Asylum Records nearly a decade ago.

Details: The Boom Clap hitmaker added a glittering body chain across her chest, while a thick, chunky chain was attached to her trousers

Star status: Despite the dark, atmospheric stadium, the British hitmaker added to the look with a pair of quirky shades and drop earrings.

She rose to fame working alongside Icona Pop in the classic hit I Love It before finding incredible commercial success singing the chorus to Iggy Azalea's smash song Fancy.

Over the years the star has also raked in money from lending her talents as a songwriter, including Willi.am’s Boys & Girls and Selena Gomez's Same Old Love.

Charli is now back with her new material for her self-tiled album, released September 13th, following a five year hiatus.
description: Charli XCX, 27, proved that California was tell and truly home as she performed in style at The Fox Theater in Oakland on Wednesday.
